content.summary: Saw four orange lights

content.detailedDescription: Witness 1 narrative - my wife and i had just left a concert at chrysler arenaand were pulling on the expressway when we sighted the object.  i recall seeinga bright clear area in the center of the object where the figures were standingand also a light above the object.  there were also two or three colored lightscoming from the lower portion of the object.  there was some movement of thefigures on the craft.  suddenly it vanished from sight.Witness 2 narrative - it was a clear, cold november night and we had justentered the expressway (us 23) from ann arbor, michigan to return to toledo,ohio.  i think it was about 11:00 pm.  i dont know what made me look up, butthrough the front windshield we, my husband and i, could see a saucer-shapedobject.  it wasnt very high up and directly in front of us.  there was a row ofwindows around the middle which seemed to be lighted from the inside.  thesaucer never seemed to move, even though we were moving, but stayed the samedistance from the car.  as we watched, three figures came forward from somewherein the back, and appeared to look out the row of windows.  then the object wasgone.  we didnt see it leave, it just disappeared.
content.summary: Ce3-saucer shaped object seen in ann arbor

content.detailedDescription: I was standing at the back door smoking.I noticed a very brite light thatchanged from red to white.I first thought man those are very bright anticollision lights.I watched it and it just moved in in what appeared to be a veryslow tight circle.Then it faded out.I was just about to come back in and it justreappeared in the same spot.It did this several times. the duration was about15-20 mins.Then it made a sudden movement to the side got very brite and thenjust faded out.
content.summary: Very bright star looking light

content.detailedDescription: Witness statement:1. in house looking out glass doors.  2. wife noticed orange line of lights attreetop level in cow pasture behind house. 3. possibly a fire in a palm tree. 4.Wewent outside to see what it was. it began grouping into lines of 2 or three,then three in triangular pattern. single objects would split into two or moreand then go back together. final appearance same night was at least seven in aneat row at tree top level. three shut off, two appeared far above treetops.Zoomed in with digital zoom on super-8 sony camera revealing cluster of threelights pulsating red/yellow/orange in triangle shape. video does not do itjustice. autozoom worked terribly, very pixelated.  nonetheless, quite amazing.Please, only those in official capacity at mufon to contact me or even mentionmyname. please no hoopla. to view area of sighting, go towww.Appraiser.Co.Brevard.Fl.Us (county appraisers web site) and enter lakeandrew drive to search. west side of lake andrew drive. view 1999 aerial view ofcow pasture and developing subdivision.
content.summary: Organized groupings of light over cow pasture behi
7-9 amber lights moving northeast in illinois
Saw objects that used appraoching storm fronts as
Ball of light silently streaking across sky

content.detailedDescription: i was on my way to work. i stopped at a stop signand noticed a bright light rising from the woods beside the road. at first ithought it was a helicopter because it went straight up. there was no sound (mywindow was down). two state troopers had stopped and saw it also. it rosestraight up and stopped. it had formed a triangle with two other lights. atfirst i thought the other two lights were stars because they had not yet moved.After they had formed the triangle they moved together as one with lights ateach corner. i was able to follow them (or it) for about 7-10 minutes, until ilost it inthe street lights.
content.summary: Saw three lights form a triangle and fly as one un

content.detailedDescription: Sightings occurred over a two day period commencing sunday 1/27 to monday 1/28. my friend and i were traveling from springfield va to woodbridge, va.  wenoticed what looked like a plane (or something) falling straight down like itwas going to crash.  additionally, there were other fiery objects falling fromthe sky, but more in an arc position.  we first thought this may be space junk,but simultaneously, we could see about 5 or 6 silvery roundish crafts very highin the sky (40k feet2b2b) at different places.  they would appear and then disappear and appear again. we were first thinking it was space junk, until the falling, fiery thingsturned from going south and headed back in a northwest direction.  i could onlyequate these things as having a fiery propulsion from them.My husbands coworkeradmitted to seeing the same things on sunday, but he thought it was space junk. he did not see the objects go north.  however, i arrived home from work at 445pon monday (next day) and the same objects were out and about again, doing thesame things.  i got a picture showing three of them.  one object in particular,appears glinty and metallic in nature (when the pic is blown up).  it was atthis time that i really saw the fire coming from the back of the objects as onecame much closer than the others i had previously seen.  these objects werethere for quite some time.  i lost sight of them on both occassions when theyjust disappeared.
content.summary: Silvery and fiery objects (5-6)
Bright golden orange stationary lights visible ove
Two triangle lighted flying objects

content.detailedDescription: On the date in question, mr.____ and his daughter saw a large (150 wide) discabove north territorial road in ann arbor, mich. in october 1965 (1966?)on the date in question, the father and his daughter had stopped in the drivewayof mr.____s fathers house at (address deleted) when the father first becameaware of the object, he thought it was an airliner.  then he noticed it washovering.  could it be a helicopter?  no, he thought, because it seemed to be700 to 800 feet above the road, but he could hear no noise.  he was stunned.  heand his daughter watched the object for eight to ten minutes, after which itslowly went off to the north-west.To the father, it seemed to be a 150 foot wide disc with white lights allaround, "like the cabin lights on an airliner."the father discussed the sighting with his daughter, but decided to mention itonly to close friends, as the "marsh gas" business discouraged him from making areport.  however, the "marsh gas" furor took place in 1966, which would placethe father a year off.During the saline flap of december 1972, the father mentioned this sighting tosome of his employees, from one of whom i learned of the sighting.
content.summary: Ma-1 - large disc seen in ann arbor, michigan

content.detailedDescription: On saturday, july 7, 2001, i was very tired so i decided to go to bed early.  at10:00 pm i called my friend who i talk to every night to say i was going to bed. she was not in her apartment so i left a message on her recorder and coveredthe bird who is about five feet from the door wall.  the door wall blinds wereshut.  at 10:05 pm, as usual, i looked out to check the weather, goings-on ifany and mostly the sky.  i love to look at the clouds, stars and sky in general. there are flood lights on the patio.  at this time i saw two lights, red andblue, in the sky to the east of me (my left).  thinking that it was a plane, iwatched it.  but it moved very fast and the red and blue lights went on and off. it seemed as though the object was spinning.  it went four spins in the fourseconds that it was in my view.  i saw it from left to right (east to west).  itgot to a tree in my vision and disappeared.  when i couldnt see it, i looked tothe right of the tree foliage for it but it was gone.  i could not make out thesize or shape of the object but i heard no plane.  it was silent.  it seemed tobe about six hundred feet in the air.  according to the distance, apart from thelights, i figured it to be about the size of a plane.  it was parallel with fordroad or just south of it.  it went from east to west in a straight line.  thered and blue lights were larger than that of a plane and very vivid in color.Primary witness had second sighting a few nights (3 days) later when, "i lookedout the door wall in like manor and saw what looked like a plane with many whitelights and they were flashing very rapidly.  it moved south to north very fast. this was later in the evening than the first sighting - about 11:45 pm. i saw itcoming from the south and it looked as if it were a ball covered with lightsthat flashed rapidly.  then it was out of my vision to the north in just a fewseconds.
content.summary: Red/blue blinking lights seen in westland, michiga
Whiteish lights in sky
Very large craft , bronze colored, saw on a waning

content.detailedDescription: Notation from georgia director of mufon regarding the creditials of the pw inthis case; michael d. hitt, the primary witness (pw) in this case is a 45 yoa georgiapolice veteran with 20+ years of service as a full time sworn and certifiedgeorgia peace officer.  he is currently serving as a patrol officer with a majormetro atlanta area agency and has 20 years of service in that department. pwalso holds a degree in criminal justice.  furthermore, the pw has past servicein the u.S. army as a forward observer in the artillery, serving in korea; laterin the military police, served as an nco, and with additional service on thestaff of a historical unit of the u.S. army.  pw is also now a publishedhistorian, specializing in the history of the north fulton county and roswellgeorgia area and the civil war era.  pw is currently an ssd/fi with mufongawhile concurrently serving as the historian and archivist of the georgia chapterof mufon.  the most recent published work of pw is georgias aerial phenomenon1947-1987, which he completed while working closely with jan aldrich andproject 1947. to further document the credentials of this pw, a descriptive linkregarding this book can be found at <<>>tom sheets, sd mufonga
content.summary: Fast maneuvering red point of light

content.detailedDescription: Witness describes first seeing the light while shaking rugs on back porch. looked up and saw light.First seen at about 30 degrees to horizon directly to west and was heading dueeast.  appeared as brilliant (but not dazzling) white light. this initial anglewould place light over nearby woods.  light continued toward witness (east) atestimated altitude of 3-4000 ft. in 15-20 seconds light had gone from 30 degreeelevation to 60 degree elevation relative to witness.  then light stopped in midair for about 5 seconds, then winked out.  witness first believed light wasaircraft landing light (grass airstrip 3 miles west of witness) but changedimpression when she could not hear engine (very little surface wind) or seeconventional craft outline (dusk-but no stars yet visible) - thinks aircraftwould probably been outlined.When light stopped in air witness became frightened.  when light went out, shewent in house and locked her doors. she claims she had impression that thislight was aware of her presence.  through out the sighting she heard no noise and experienced no em effects. witness felt object was climbing during sighting.  witness claims that to herknowledge, no one else saw the light.
content.summary: Nocturnal light stops in mid air near milan, michi
I was abducted
Four rapid position changing white lights

content.detailedDescription: Sighting account:the witness was on a break from her job as an inventory controller at a companywarehouse in stevens point, wi.  she was standing in a small shelter near thesouth side of the building, which provided an excellent view to the south.  herattention was caught by an orange flash low in the southwestern sky.Her initial reaction was concern that the flash might have been from an airplanecrash.  however as she watched, the flash quickly faded and she noted otherlights in about the same elevation and direction.  these appeared to bestationary or maneuvering.  she also saw a second pair of sustained orangeflashes (flares) appearing in the region in which the lights were maneuvering. as the plane crash concern lessened in her mind, she now found the light showinteresting and impressive (her literal words: cooler than fireworks).   in a few minutes, she was joined by the second witness, who had also come out totake a break from work.  the second witness also noticed the lights, but wasfrightened by them - feeling that they might be associated with war. description of object/lights:the witness described initial flash and the later orange flashes to the south asbeing about 1 to 2 inches long at arms length [cl note: it was not clear if thiswas the path length traveled by the light sources, or if it was the actual sizeof an object/light].  the two flashes lasted for about three seconds and seemedto parallel each other.  they seemed to remain relatively stationary and thendisappeared.The other lights were described as white and twinkling.  they appeared to befast moving  and were described as being difficult to actually count.  theprimary witness estimated that there were about 5 or 6 lights present.  she alsonoted that there were no red or green lights associated with them, which mightbe expected on aircraft.  the lights motion was generally such that one wouldseem to vanish from one spot and reappear in a different spot (about 4 inchesaway at arms length).  she did not observe motion between the two points [note:elapsed time between disappearance and reappearance?].Both witnesses felt that the altitude was not extremely high.  the primarywitness gave an elevation of about 30 to 45 degrees.  they appeared to be at anelevation at, or above the level of nearby telephone wires which were about 70yards away. [cl note: an elevation of less than 15 degrees would be required inorder to be consistent with geometry of distant aircraft maneuvers.  seeanalysis, below].  the two witnesses watched the lights for what they estimated to be about 10minutes.  during that time they brought the light show to the attention ofanother employee who was nearby working briefly on a truck at the warehouse(note: his name, but no other contact information is known).Sighting ending:one light then headed quickly from the south-southwestern sky to the southernsky where it vanished.  the witness describes the other lights as vanishing. the primary witness indicates that the lights disappeared with no observabledeparture or fade-out.
content.summary: Stevens point, wi multiple witness/multiple object
8 lights form two diamond figures and speed off ac

content.detailedDescription: i had just moved to this area and was taking aphoto of the field adjacent to my new apartment.  it was a very windy day but asi snapped this shot an extremely strong gust of wind knocked me off balance.  idid not see anything unusual through the cameras viewfinder when i took theshot but the wind gust sounded like a loud roar.  i had my film developed at thelocal wal-mart and questioned the employee about the object on the right handside of this photo and he assured me the object was on the negative.  i had thepicture enlarged at a camera shop in austin.  i have pondered its origin andsubmitted the picture to art bell (e-mail) but have not received a reply. sometimes i feel i should drop my inquiry but it would be meaningful to get someprofessional feedback.  what do you think?
content.summary: Ufo caught unknowningly on film
Coming home from grocery shopping in willoughby, o
A object that was triangular as viewed threw binoc
Tetrahedron  over  the  beach ( confidental )

content.detailedDescription: I was only a kid and my date might be off by a year or so, i think i was 7 or 8.I was in my backyard playing by myself when i saw a triangle shaped objectfloating close enough for me to get some detail.  the strangest part was itwasnt flying flat, or fast. it seemed to be slow and rotating as it flew overme. i couldnt tell you if i watched it fly away or not. i do not remember.
content.summary: Trialngle shape, rotating about 100 feet off groun
Glowing red ball of light

content.detailedDescription: my family and i were driving to little rock atnight,i was driving and my wife was in the passenger seat. there are hills inthe area and we were heading east when i noticed a dim single light coming overthe hill ahead to the right side of the highway very low and i would estimatethe speed at 350 to 400 knots. it was starlike and traveling in a northerndirection,i didnt think much of it untill not far behind it was a group oflights chasing it,three starlike that looked as though they were differentcolors in a small triangular arrangement. they vanashed over the hill on thenorthern side of the highway.   i spent ten years in the navy as an aircraftmechanic and have seen my share of every type of aircraft,these lights were notflashing, they were steady and starlike. the distance between the first lightand the three following was i believe about 500 feet.
content.summary: Strange lights were seen while driving on  interst
String of lights, no sound, shaped like bomber pla

content.detailedDescription: We were driving to jack in the box to get something to eat when we noticed it upin the sky.  we pulled over and got out.  we looked up toward the richland skyand saw it moving north.  we were in kennewick.  we watched it until it was outof sight.  it moved very fast.  it was like 3 v-shaped lights.
content.summary: 3 v-shaped lights flying fast
